initial_reviews.review_title: The Best Email Marketing Platform I've Used
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Bento?
It has very simple list-size based pricing, and you get all the features no matter what. The email marketing piece is great by itself, but when you layer in Flows, you can take the automation of your marketing to a whole other level. The support is also personalized and community based, which makes getting help very easy.

What do you dislike about Bento?
From a business perspective, choosing a small team like Bento (vs a large corporation) could be a risk for some, but there are emergency safeguards in place, so I'm personally not worried. From a technical perspective, I haven't experienced any significant shortcomings. At the time of writing, there is no Android app which make monitoring live chat slightly limited.

What problems is Bento solving and how is that benefiting you?
I tried other Platforms in Bento is by far the best. It is superior in its feature set and it is helping me reach my customers while automated the entire workflow process.

initial_reviews.review_title: Powerful Email Automation for Product Owners
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Bento?
The power and flexibility in setting up email automation flows is incredible. By adding a tag based on an action (such as a purchase) or where they signed up, you can trigger any number of email flows and change it based on actions they take. Replicating the basic flows I had before in Mailchimp was easy, and I now have all that I need to add more complex flows going forward.

What do you dislike about Bento?
None! The support in helping me get set up was first class, and after a short 1:1 onboarding session, I'm all set.

What problems is Bento solving and how is that benefiting you?
The features in Mailchimp for automation flows became more and more complex, and you were restricted to only a very basic one-step automation unless you paid a substantially higher fee. Not only do I get all the tools I need with Bento, their support is incredible if I need it. Bento also provides a WordPress + Easy Digital Downloads plugin to easily track my customers when they make a purchase. I can set up an email sequence based on what product(s) they have purchased.

Bento is full to gill with features for power users of marketing automation and ensures that you can create any marketing journey you want as per your needs.

Integrations a plenty with a founder that actively engages with the community on Discord is the cherry on top.

Also, due to their extremely focus on deliverability, the IP addresses are always healthy which helps your message get to customers.

We send emailers to our clients multiple times a week and almost never see and issue. As a bonus their batching feature has saved our neck more than once.

What do you dislike about Bento?
The UI can be overwhelming for new users.

A lot of things to learn when you first get started.

If they had generic templates of best practices that would help.

What problems is Bento solving and how is that benefiting you?
As an e-commerce store staying in touch with our customers via email is extremely important.

Bento makes that easy and always allows us to deliver a customized high touch approach to our clients.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Bento?
I'm supremely confident Bento can handle any email marketing requirements I might dream up, thanks to its powerful automation tools (flows).

Crucially, it's also possible to debug that automation, to see precisely what events/actions have occurred for each subscriber, via Bento's detailed logs. This puts it above other tools which hide that information, or only paint a partial picture.

What do you dislike about Bento?
As a developer I find it easy to work with. Saying that, I get the impression that, for less technical folk it could be a little overwhelming, with a relatively steep initial learning curve (personally I got over that hump within the first few days!)

What problems is Bento solving and how is that benefiting you?
I want people who visit my blog to ultimately have the opportunity to become customers.

Bento handles this flow for me, taking people from initial signup, through onboarding, then on to a number of pitch sequences (sent over a period of time). I also use Bento to end out my weekly "shadow" newsletter (a compilation of my most useful emails/articles) plus my semi-regular "live" newsletter (sent via broadcasts).

initial_reviews.review_title: Packed with features and a joy to use
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Bento?
Bento offers features that are hard to find in other email marketing solutions, such as tracking visitors on the site before they even sign up and a chat system. In addition, being event-based allows for incredibly powerful and flexible automations. Bento also has some goodies such as the ability to send emails in batches, the ability to group tags into groups, and the ability to set tags to expire. In addition, although a lot of external services do not integrate directly with Bento, it is really very easy to integrate with this email marketing automation solution.
I personally use it mostly on WordPress sites and implementing it with this CMS is really easy.
Since I started using Bento I have also seen an increase in the delivarability of my messages.
I was also positively impressed by the support through Discord. It is very easy to talk and get quick answers directly from the founder of Bento. A whole different thing from the long wait times that happen with other services. In some cases, with Bento, new features are added in no time at all.

What do you dislike about Bento?
So far I have not had any problems with Bento.
However, it would not be bad if there was more documentation on the site. At the moment most of the information is accessible mainly by participating in discussions on Discord and searching the archives of past conversations.

What problems is Bento solving and how is that benefiting you?
Making email marketing automation activities easier through contact segmentation, based on user interactions.

I also use Bento to end out my weekly "shadow" newsletter (a compilation of my most useful emails/articles) plus my semi-regular "live" newsletter (sent via broadcasts).

all_reviews.review_title: Packed with features and a joy to use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Bento?
Bento offers features that are hard to find in other email marketing solutions, such as tracking visitors on the site before they even sign up and a chat system. In addition, being event-based allows for incredibly powerful and flexible automations. Bento also has some goodies such as the ability to send emails in batches, the ability to group tags into groups, and the ability to set tags to expire. In addition, although a lot of external services do not integrate directly with Bento, it is really very easy to integrate with this email marketing automation solution.
I personally use it mostly on WordPress sites and implementing it with this CMS is really easy.
Since I started using Bento I have also seen an increase in the delivarability of my messages.
I was also positively impressed by the support through Discord. It is very easy to talk and get quick answers directly from the founder of Bento. A whole different thing from the long wait times that happen with other services. In some cases, with Bento, new features are added in no time at all.

What do you dislike about Bento?
So far I have not had any problems with Bento.
However, it would not be bad if there was more documentation on the site. At the moment most of the information is accessible mainly by participating in discussions on Discord and searching the archives of past conversations.

What problems is Bento solving and how is that benefiting you?
Making email marketing automation activities easier through contact segmentation, based on user interactions.
